articles.author: Benj Edwards
articles.title: Spotify tests using AI to automatically clone and translate podcast voices | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: Feature hopes to remove language barriers, but will speakers know if translations are faulty?
articles.content: 4 with On Monday, Spotify rolled out a limited pilot program that uses AI to automatically translate podcasts into various languages, using voice synthesis technology from OpenAI to preserve the or [+4114 chars]
articles.summary: Spotify rolled out a limited pilot program that uses AI to automatically translate podcasts into various languages using voice synthesis technology from OpenAI. The feature is currently being used with only select podcasters such as Dax Shepard Monica Padman Lex Fridman Bill Simmons and Steven Bartlett. The translated episodes will be available worldwide to both Premium and Free users. Users can access the translations via Spotify s Now Playing View for supported episodes or a dedicated Voice Translations Hub that will continue to add more translated content.
articles.html_summary:
• Spotify rolled out a limited pilot program that uses AI to automatically translate podcasts into various languages using voice synthesis technology from OpenAI.
  • The feature is currently being used with only select podcasters such as Dax Shepard Monica Padman Lex Fridman Bill Simmons and Steven Bartlett.
  • The translated episodes will be available worldwide to both Premium and Free users.
  • Users can access the translations via Spotify s Now Playing View for supported episodes or a dedicated Voice Translations Hub that will continue to add more translated content.

articles.author: Stephen Clark
articles.title: Space Force chief says commercial satellites may need defending | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: It would stand to reason that same philosophy would extend into space.
articles.content: Enlarge/ Gen. Chance Saltzman, the top general on the US Space Force, testifies before a Senate subcommittee in March.19 with Like the US Navy has long protected sea lanes during conflict, the mi [+3556 chars]
articles.summary: Gen Chance Saltzman echoed many statements made by military leaders over the last few years US military space capabilities are under threat from China and Russia military leaders need more information about what other countries are doing in space. commercial satellites are playing an ever larger role in the military s space programs. A hypothetical military operation to defend a commercial satellite from an adversary s attack would likely go through US Space Command. It would be up to civilian leadership to set the priorities on what commercial capabilities to defend from attack.
articles.html_summary:
• Gen Chance Saltzman echoed many statements made by military leaders over the last few years US military space capabilities are under threat from China and Russia military leaders need more information about what other countries are doing in space.
  • commercial satellites are playing an ever larger role in the military s space programs.
  • A hypothetical military operation to defend a commercial satellite from an adversary s attack would likely go through US Space Command.
  • It would be up to civilian leadership to set the priorities on what commercial capabilities to defend from attack.

articles.author: Stephen Clark
articles.title: Scientists just opened the lid to NASAs asteroid sample canister | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: There is some black dustlike material thats visible. Were hoping thats from Bennu.
articles.content: Enlarge/ The lid is open on the OSIRISREx sample return canister, revealing a tantalizing ring of dust outside the main sample collection chamber.20 with Dante Lauretta has waited nearly 20 year [+5291 chars]
articles.summary: Dante Lauretta a planetary scientist at the University of Arizona has waited nearly years to get his hands on pristine specimens from an asteroid which he says is a key to unlocking answers to mysteries about the origin of life on Earth. On Tuesday he got his first look at dust grains returned by NASA s OSIRIS REx mission. The dust grains visible immediately after scientists opened the lid to the canister are from asteroid Bennu where the OSIRis REx spacecraft captured rocks during a touch and go landing in the Solar System.
articles.html_summary:
• Dante Lauretta a planetary scientist at the University of Arizona has waited nearly years to get his hands on pristine specimens from an asteroid which he says is a key to unlocking answers to mysteries about the origin of life on Earth.
  • On Tuesday he got his first look at dust grains returned by NASA s OSIRIS REx mission.
  • The dust grains visible immediately after scientists opened the lid to the canister are from asteroid Bennu where the OSIRis REx spacecraft captured rocks during a touch and go landing in the Solar System.

articles.author: Samuel Axon
articles.title: PlayStation scifi epic Horizon Forbidden West makes its way to PC | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: Postapocalyptic heroine Aloy will return to Steam and the Epic Game Store soon.
articles.content: 34 with  The release will include the Californiabased expansion that was recently launched.  The game was praised for its strong cast of characters.  Much of th [+2925 chars]
articles.summary: Horizon Forbidden West Complete Edition will be released on PC in early October. The PC release will include both the base game and the recently released Burning Shores DLC. The complete edition will also launch on PlayStation but a bit earlier on October of this year The PC port will be handled by Nixxes which previously did a mostly bang up job porting Sony studio Insomniac Games Spider Man and Spider Man Miles Morales to PC. The game will be available on the Epic Games Store and Steam with product pages already launched on both.
articles.html_summary:
• Horizon Forbidden West Complete Edition will be released on PC in early October.
  • The PC release will include both the base game and the recently released Burning Shores DLC.
  • The complete edition will also launch on PlayStation but a bit earlier on October of this year The PC port will be handled by Nixxes which previously did a mostly bang up job porting Sony studio Insomniac Games Spider Man and Spider Man Miles Morales to PC.
  • The game will be available on the Epic Games Store and Steam with product pages already launched on both.

articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.title: Erudit raises $10M to monitor workplaces for misalignment | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: According to one poll, searches for staff monitoring software rose by 75% in March 2020 compared with the 2019 monthly average  and demand remained strong ...
articles.content: Employee surveillance is on the rise. According to one poll, searches for staff monitoring software rose by 75% in March 2020 compared with the 2019 monthly average  and demand remained strong in 2 [+4877 chars]
articles.summary: Erudit which uses AI to keep track of workforce stats like turnover risk and burnout rate raised million in a Series A funding round led by Conexo Ventures. Erudit connects to the apps a company already uses like Slack Microsoft Teams and Zoom to attempt to get a pulse on the organization. The company runs the data it collects through a set of AI algorithms which generates scores along metrics such as alignment autonomy engagement and satisfaction. But this reporter worries about the potential for mistakes and misinterpretations as well as other forms of bias.
articles.html_summary:
• Erudit which uses AI to keep track of workforce stats like turnover risk and burnout rate raised million in a Series A funding round led by Conexo Ventures.
  • Erudit connects to the apps a company already uses like Slack Microsoft Teams and Zoom to attempt to get a pulse on the organization.
  • The company runs the data it collects through a set of AI algorithms which generates scores along metrics such as alignment autonomy engagement and satisfaction.
  • But this reporter worries about the potential for mistakes and misinterpretations as well as other forms of bias.

articles.title: Doubles taxes on guns, ammo... | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom has signed a law that will raise taxes on guns and ammunition. The federal government already taxes guns at 10% or 11%. The law Newsom signed on Tuesday adds an 11% tax on top of that. The money will pay for things like security i
articles.content: California governor signs law raising taxes on guns and ammunition to pay for school safetySACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP)  California will double the taxes on guns and ammunition and use the money to pay f [+5594 chars]
articles.summary: Gov Gavin Newsom on Tuesday signed three bills aimed at reducing gun violence including an percent state tax on guns and ammunition to pay for gun safety programs. Gun rights advocates plan to challenge the new tax in court. California has some of the lowest gun death rates in the country ranking rd out of states with deaths for every people according to data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. But violent crimes have increased recently with the violent crime rate increased by in according to the California Department of Justice. The laws were some of nearly two dozen gun control measures Newsom signed on Tuesday.

• Gov Gavin Newsom on Tuesday signed three bills aimed at reducing gun violence including an percent state tax on guns and ammunition to pay for gun safety programs.
  • Gun rights advocates plan to challenge the new tax in court.
  • California has some of the lowest gun death rates in the country ranking rd out of states with deaths for every people according to data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
  • But violent crimes have increased recently with the violent crime rate increased by in according to the California Department of Justice.
  • The laws were some of nearly two dozen gun control measures Newsom signed on Tuesday.

articles.author: Carrie Andrews
articles.title: Fintech actually has a value system Heres how we can reclaim it | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: One of the big lessons of the social finance backlash is that empowerment without education can do more harm than good.
articles.content: The technologies underlying fintech point to a world of empowerment and access, transparency and efficiency. And yet the past few years tell a story in which fintechs most prominent players have bee [+6269 chars]
articles.summary: These include fintech-driven services that enrich workers standard of living in concrete ways, with services that empower them and take some of the stress out of the day-to-day grind.Such services might include user-friendly HR systems that offer better access to everything from time cards to intra-company promotions. I think the answer is yes.Looking back, one of the frustrating things about fintechs recent blowups (crypto, meme trades and FTX among them) is that so many have involved applications and business models that have shown (and still show) so much potential to make a positive difference. Not surprisingly, many innovative fintechs  maybe better seen as hybrid fintech/edtechs  are building better financial literacy and education models and technologies. Austin-based Zogo, for example, is a technology company that works with financial institutions to promote financial education and well-being through short-form content. But at this moment in our economic and social history, we cant afford to have fintech held back by those who would subvert the very values its technologies are meant to elevate. But to some workers, especially those in hospitality, retail, manufacturing, and skilled and unskilled trades, on-demand pay is a boon.All of these products and services are a far cry from meme stocks and digital bank runs. Employers can lessen the burden by providing fully functioning and well-priced bank accounts, debit cards and earned-wage access and early pay.Earned-wage access is, essentially, on-demand payment for hours worked.
articles.html_summary:
• These include fintech-driven services that enrich workers’ standard of living in concrete ways, with services that empower them and take some of the stress out of the day-to-day grind.Such services might include user-friendly HR systems that offer better access to everything from “time cards” to intra-company promotions..
  • I think the answer is yes.Looking back, one of the frustrating things about fintech’s recent blowups (crypto, meme trades and FTX among them) is that so many have involved applications and business models that have shown (and still show) so much potential to make a positive difference..
  • Not surprisingly, many innovative fintechs — maybe better seen as hybrid fintech/edtechs — are building better financial literacy and education models and technologies..
  • Austin-based Zogo, for example, is a technology company that works with financial institutions to promote financial education and well-being through short-form content..
  • But at this moment in our economic and social history, we can’t afford to have fintech held back by those who would subvert the very values its technologies are meant to elevate..
  • But to some workers, especially those in hospitality, retail, manufacturing, and skilled and unskilled trades, on-demand pay is a boon.All of these products and services are a far cry from meme stocks and digital bank runs..

articles.author: Jonathan M. Gitlin
articles.title: Powerful new EV charger starts field tests in Arizona this weekend | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: From Thursday until Sunday, charges will cost just one dollar.
articles.content: Enlarge/ This cube is Nxus new charging system, designed to handle up to 4.5 MW of bidirectional power. You can test it out in Mesa, Arizona, between September 28 and October 1, 2023.10 with Ele [+2949 chars]
articles.summary: Electric vehicles have matured over the past decade to the point where with few exceptions they re now a superior alternative to internal combustion engines. The problem is that recharging an EV battery takes longer than refilling a fuel tank with liquid fuel. Even the fastest fast charging EV still needs minutes to get from to percent state of charge with to minutes being more common for most EVs on sale today. Those long charge times are one of the driving forces behind the interest in hydrogen fuel cell EVs despite the terrible efficiency losses involved in making and using that fuel.
articles.html_summary:
• Electric vehicles have matured over the past decade to the point where with few exceptions they re now a superior alternative to internal combustion engines.
  • The problem is that recharging an EV battery takes longer than refilling a fuel tank with liquid fuel.
  • Even the fastest fast charging EV still needs minutes to get from to percent state of charge with to minutes being more common for most EVs on sale today.
  • Those long charge times are one of the driving forces behind the interest in hydrogen fuel cell EVs despite the terrible efficiency losses involved in making and using that fuel.

articles.author: Ars Contributors
articles.title: We try out the first legal level 3 automated driving system in the US | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: This is the first driver assist to allow you to take your eyes off the road.
articles.content: Enlarge/ The front panel of a Drive Pilotequipped EQS conceals its lidar and other sensors.12 with LOS ANGELESMercedesBenz has never shied away from new technology. Historically, the carmaker h [+2570 chars]
articles.summary: Drive Pilot will be available on the Mercedes Benz S Class and EQS sedans on some of the most congested highways in Los Angeles. It s the first level automated driving system approved for use in the US but initially it will only be available and active in California and Nevada. Drive Pilot allows for hands free highway driving similar to other systems such as Super Cruise from GM BlueCruise from Ford or Highway Assistant from BMW. Certain conditions must be satisfied before you can activate Drive Pilot an important concept in autonomous driving known as the operational design domain.
articles.html_summary:
• Drive Pilot will be available on the Mercedes Benz S Class and EQS sedans on some of the most congested highways in Los Angeles.
  • It s the first level automated driving system approved for use in the US but initially it will only be available and active in California and Nevada.
  • Drive Pilot allows for hands free highway driving similar to other systems such as Super Cruise from GM BlueCruise from Ford or Highway Assistant from BMW.
  • Certain conditions must be satisfied before you can activate Drive Pilot an important concept in autonomous driving known as the operational design domain.

articles.author: Kevin Purdy
articles.title: EVgo knows that DC fast charging is still rough, so its fixing more stations | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: Its a tricky thing, telling customers that your stations are far from perfect.
articles.content: Enlarge/ If my dad had been able to show me the intricate dance between smartphone app, car, cable, and station, perhaps my first outing wouldnt have been quite so confusing.31 with EVgo, one of [+3863 chars]
articles.summary: EVgo one of the nation s largest DC fast charging providers seems to be coming around to the idea that while having more chargers would be nice having reliably functioning chargers is more important at the moment. As part of EVgo ReNew the company s plan focuses on overall network performance and the holistic customer experience. EVgo rated a out of in that study roughly midway between ChargePoint at and Electrify America at with all of them dropping from Tesla meanwhile with its nationwide network of Supercharger spots with first mover placement advantage rated out of unchanged.

articles.author: John Timmer
articles.title: In depression treatment trials, placebo effect is growing stronger | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: As with placebo pills, time is making placebo magnetic stimulation more effective.
articles.content: Enlarge/ A decent placebo setup for transcranial magnetic stimulation is difficult to distinguish from actual treatment.1 with Placebos have occupied an increasingly awkward spot in the medical l [+5636 chars]
articles.summary: A new study has expanded on a previous finding that the placebo effect for antidepressant treatments appears to be growing stronger over time. Earlier work had shown this was happening with placebo pills The new study shows that it s happening with a treatment called transcranial magnetic stimulation. Fortunately effective treatments appear to be getting better in parallel so this hasn t obviously interfered with any results yet. The researchers estimate that it would take nearly new studies showing that there is no placebo effect to go away entirely. But it does suggest that at least some of the differences between earlier and later trials may come down to study design.
articles.html_summary:
• A new study has expanded on a previous finding that the placebo effect for antidepressant treatments appears to be growing stronger over time.
  • Earlier work had shown this was happening with placebo pills The new study shows that it s happening with a treatment called transcranial magnetic stimulation.
  • Fortunately effective treatments appear to be getting better in parallel so this hasn t obviously interfered with any results yet.
  • The researchers estimate that it would take nearly new studies showing that there is no placebo effect to go away entirely.
  • But it does suggest that at least some of the differences between earlier and later trials may come down to study design.

articles.content: Warner Music CEO Robert Kyncl believes AI will be significantly impacting the music industry within the next year. Speaking at the Code Conference this week, the industry exec said the industry shoul [+3703 chars]
articles.summary: Warner Music CEO Robert Kyncl believes AI will be significantly impacting the music industry within the next year. Warner Music is focused on working collaboratively with the largest platforms like YouTube TikTok and Spotify to help it define the rules of the road as these technologies are developed. The law will need to evolve to address AI music Name image likeness and voice should have the same protections as copyright and the same simple protections as copyrighted but it will take time he said I believe it will get there but it'll take time And in the meantime we ll work with the distribution platforms collaboratively to run ahead of that
articles.html_summary:

  • Warner Music is focused on working collaboratively with the largest platforms like YouTube TikTok and Spotify to help it define the rules of the road as these technologies are developed.
